dialogueTree.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Oh, it's you again. Are you lookin..."
dialogueTree.text: "Oh, it's you again. Are you looking for a die?"

links.title: You: ""I came back to pick up my die.""
links.text: "I came back to pick up my die."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Excellent. That will be 10 reál fo..."
links.text: "Excellent. That will be 10 reál for one set of magnetic dice."

links.title: You: "(Give her the money.) "Here you go...."
links.text: (Give her the money.) "Here you go."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""This was an especially fun set to..."
links.text: "This was an especially fun set to make," she says as she opens her drawer and hands you a sparkling pair of dice.

links.title: You: "Look at them."
links.text: Look at them.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "Dazzling! It's like you have a pair..."
links.text: Dazzling! It's like you have a pair of tiny disco balls in your hand.

links.title: You: ""Actually, I don't have the money o..."
links.text: "Actually, I don't have the money on me right now."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I don't do orders on credit. Come..."
links.text: "I don't do orders on credit. Come back when you have the full amount."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Very good. That will be seven reál..."
links.text: "Very good. That will be seven reál for one custom die."

links.title: You: "(Give her the money.) "Here you go...."
links.text: (Give her the money.) "Here you go."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""One universal die for *Wirrâl Unte..."
links.text: "One universal die for *Wirrâl Untethered*," the dicemaker opens her desk drawer and hands you a die.

links.title: You: "Look at it."
links.text: Look at it.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "It feels icy. Just holding this die..."
links.text: It feels icy. Just holding this die in your hand sends a jolt of cold down your spine. Through the dark resin, you can make out a nugget of bone hewn from an alligator's jaw.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""One standard Wirrâl role-playing d..."
links.text: "One standard Wirrâl role-playing die," the dicemaker opens her desk drawer and hands you a die.

links.title: You: "Look at it."
links.text: Look at it.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "It's a handsome red die with a mix..."
links.text: It's a handsome red die with a mix of plant symbols diligently engraved on its faces.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Here's the *cursed* die you ordere..."
links.text: "Here's the *cursed* die you ordered," the dicemaker opens her desk drawer and hands you a tiny black sphere with six phrases written on it.

links.title: You: "Read the phrases."
links.text: Read the phrases.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "The phrases read: 'God is indiffere..."
links.text: The phrases read: 'God is indifferent', 'Take all', 'Lose all', '50/50', 'Nothing happens', and 'pale'.

links.title: You: ""What is this?""
links.text: "What is this?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It's a die," confirms the dicemake..."
links.text: "It's a die," confirms the dicemaker with a subtle smile on her face. "Try rolling it."

links.title: You: "Cast the cursed die."
links.text: Cast the cursed die.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "You throw the ball on the floor and..."
links.text: You throw the ball on the floor and it ends with one of the phrases facing upwards: 'god is indifferent'.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "She looks at the result. "Good. Now..."
links.text: She looks at the result. "Good. Now roll again, detective."

links.title: You: "Roll the die again."
links.text: Roll the die again.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "It lands on exactly the same result..."
links.text: It lands on exactly the same result -- *god is indifferent* it declares again.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It's a sphere *pretending* to be a..."
links.text: "It's a sphere *pretending* to be a six-sided die -- each roll will end with one of the phrases facing up. The die originates in Iilmaraa, where it was used for cleromancy..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Except I've weighted the die. When..."
links.text: "Except I've weighted the die. When you try rolling it, you realize that each time it gets you exactly the same result -- *God is indifferent*. This is our curse."

links.title: Conceptualization: "It's even worse than she says. God..."
links.text: It's even worse than she says. God is dead -- We live in a forsaken age.

links.title: You: ""You're saying that the end result..."
links.text: "You're saying that the end result doesn't matter."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""In the face of death -- no, not re..."
links.text: "In the face of death -- no, not really."

links.title: You: ""What a relief.""
links.text: "What a relief."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It is, isn't it? There's something..."
links.text: "It is, isn't it? There's something liberating about knowing it's just we humans, no all powerful forces guiding us, watching us, *judging* us."

links.title: You: ""I'll keep that in mind. Thanks for..."
links.text: "I'll keep that in mind. Thanks for the die."

links.title: You: ""Can I get a normal version of this..."
links.text: "Can I get a normal version of this die? One that isn't modified to land on a single result?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""No, I don't have another die. You'..."
links.text: "No, I don't have another die. You'll have to do with this one."

links.title: You: ""That's so depressing.""
links.text: "That's so depressing."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""You were the one who asked for a c..."
links.text: "You were the one who asked for a cursed die," she points out.

links.title: You: ""I don't agree with you.""
links.text: "I don't agree with you."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""You don't?" she raises her brows."
links.text: "You don't?" she raises her brows.

links.title: You: ""As long as there is mankind, there..."
links.text: "As long as there is mankind, there is also meaning."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Yes, but how will mankind last?""
links.text: "Yes, but how will mankind last?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Don't answer that, actually. Meani..."
links.text: "Don't answer that, actually. Meaning is whatever you want to make of it. That's the nature of meaning."

links.title: You: ""It matters as long as we're alive.""
links.text: "It matters as long as we're alive."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I guess you can find some temporar..."
links.text: "I guess you can find some temporary solace in that, yes."

links.title: You: ""Still, thanks for the die.""
links.text: "Still, thanks for the die."

links.title: You: ""Can I get a normal version of this..."
links.text: "Can I get a normal version of this die? One that isn't modified to land on a single result?"

links.title: You: ""Doesn't really fly with my vibe, t..."
links.text: "Doesn't really fly with my vibe, too morbid."

links.title: You: ""This is mega cool, but can I get o..."
links.text: "This is mega cool, but can I get one that actually works?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Sorry, I don't have another one re..."
links.text: "Sorry, I don't have another one ready. You were the one who asked for a cursed die."

links.title: You: ""I guess I'll keep the die then.""
links.text: "I guess I'll keep the die then."

links.title: You: ""Thanks, I'll keep it.""
links.text: "Thanks, I'll keep it."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Good luck, officer," she says with..."
links.text: "Good luck, officer," she says with a mischievous smile, before turning back to her table.

links.title: You: ""I don't want to roll again.""
links.text: "I don't want to roll again."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Why?" Neha starts laughing. "You'r..."
links.text: "Why?" Neha starts laughing. "You're not scared, officer, are you?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I'm not a witch, mister, and neith..."
links.text: "I'm not a witch, mister, and neither is this die cursed," she assures you. "We live in a rational world -- there is no *black magic*."

links.title: You: ""No, I'm not deranged. I don't want..."
links.text: "No, I'm not deranged. I don't want to roll a *cursed die*."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Wait, you're not scared, are you?"..."
links.text: "Wait, you're not scared, are you?" The dicemaker starts laughing. "Officer, you don't actually think I put a spell on it, do you?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I'm not a witch, you know. We live..."
links.text: "I'm not a witch, you know. We live in a rational world. There is no *black magic*."

links.title: You: ""I've already learned about horrors..."
links.text: "I've already learned about horrors like *pale* and I can't take any further risks."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""You're right," she simmers down. "..."
links.text: "You're right," she simmers down. "The pale is terrible indeed. But I didn't curse the die. I don't believe in curses."

links.title: You: ""I'm not *scared*, I just don't *fe..."
links.text: "I'm not *scared*, I just don't *feel* like rolling it."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Right. But it isn't cursed, honest..."
links.text: "Right. But it isn't cursed, honestly. I'll tell you what it does."

links.title: You: ""Better safe than sorry.""
links.text: "Better safe than sorry."

links.title: You: ""There are *definitely* dark-magiks.""
links.text: "There are *definitely* dark-magiks."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Not in this die, rest assured. It..."
links.text: "Not in this die, rest assured. It isn't cursed. I can tell you what it does."

links.title: You: ""No, you're a malignant *Entity*. A..."
links.text: "No, you're a malignant *Entity*. A die-crafting witch."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""So now I'm a witch too. Rhymes wel..."
links.text: "So now I'm a witch too. Rhymes well with the whole me-being-a-culprit theme."

links.title: You: ""So you confess?""
links.text: "So you confess?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Sure!" She laughs. "Now can the *E..."
links.text: "Sure!" She laughs. "Now can the *Entity* explain what your cursed die does?"

links.title: You: ""I am nothing if not consistent.""
links.text: "I am nothing if not consistent."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Fantastic. Can the witch *Entity*..."
links.text: "Fantastic. Can the witch *Entity* tell you what the cursed die does then?"

links.title: You: ""Yes, I've got my warpaint protecti..."
links.text: "Yes, I've got my warpaint protecting me from the evil." (Point to your face.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Oh, now I'm evil, too -- lovely.""
links.text: "Oh, now I'm evil, too -- lovely."

links.title: You: ""Yes, it's better to know how the e..."
links.text: "Yes, it's better to know how the evil works."

links.title: You: ""No, I don't want to know, it's too..."
links.text: "No, I don't want to know, it's too dangerous."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Too bad, I'm going to tell you any..."
links.text: "Too bad, I'm going to tell you anyway."

links.title: You: ""This is not a die.""
links.text: "This is not a die."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Here's your amber die," the dicema..."
links.text: "Here's your amber die," the dicemaker opens her desk drawer and hands you a die the colour of dark syrup.

links.title: You: "Look at it."
links.text: Look at it.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "There appears to be a small fly emb..."
links.text: There appears to be a small fly embedded within. It's like looking into a lost little world...

links.title: You: ""How did you become a dicemaker?""
links.text: "How did you become a dicemaker?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""How did I *become* one? It was a b..."
links.text: "How did I *become* one? It was a business decision. I was a regular jeweller at first, but that's an unfocused field -- with too much competition."

links.title: Half Light: "She doesn't let it show, but there'..."
links.text: She doesn't let it show, but there's anger in there -- she doesn't like jewellers. Thinks they're a mob.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Some of my friends were role-playe..."
links.text: "Some of my friends were role-players. They asked me to make some polyhedral dice out of cobalt. That was my first order. I grew it from there."

links.title: You: ""Do you like role-playing games you..."
links.text: "Do you like role-playing games yourself?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Not especially. I like working wit..."
links.text: "Not especially. I like working with rare materials and a steady pay. And role-players as customers -- they're nice people."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Some of those nice people have big..."
links.text: Some of those nice people have big bucks to spend on novelty items.

links.title: Empathy: "She's thankful for the security the..."
links.text: She's thankful for the security they provide her.

links.title: You: ""Understood.""
links.text: "Understood."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I've grown crafty over the years...."
links.text: "I've grown crafty over the years. You'll like your dice, I'm sure of it."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I've grown crafty over the years...."
links.text: "I've grown crafty over the years. You'll like your dice, if you get them from me. Be sure of it."

links.title: You: ""Okay. I'd like to order a die from..."
links.text: "Okay. I'd like to order a die from you."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I'm sorry. I'm a bit overloaded ju..."
links.text: "I'm sorry. I'm a bit overloaded just now so I can only produce one die per customer."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Of course," she nods -- this is wh..."
links.text: "Of course," she nods -- this is what she's here for. "Tell me what you have in mind."

links.title: You: ""I want a die for the Wirrâl settin..."
links.text: "I want a die for the Wirrâl setting, sweet and basic."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""That's a classic, yes. A standard..."
links.text: "That's a classic, yes. A standard role-playing die with plant motifs. Now for the material: Most of my customers opt for an exotic wood -- for this I would suggest East-Semenese Snakewood."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""For seven reál I could have it rea..."
links.text: "For seven reál I could have it ready in eight hours."

links.title: You: ""What's a standard role-playing die?""
links.text: "What's a standard role-playing die?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It's an *icositetrahedron* -- a 24..."
links.text: "It's an *icositetrahedron* -- a 24-sided die that can produce results for a 2-sided, 3-sided, 4-sided, 6-sided, and 12-sided die with a single roll. Technically you can also use it for many other sizes, but you may need to re-roll results."

links.title: You: ""It's a deal." (Order the die.)"
links.text: "It's a deal." (Order the die.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Great! See you in eight hours then..."
links.text: "Great! See you in eight hours then." She takes a small notebook from her table and writes something down. "Was there anything else?"

links.title: You: ""I need to think about it." (Back o..."
links.text: "I need to think about it." (Back off.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Maybe you have some other ideas fo..."
links.text: "Maybe you have some other ideas for dice?"

links.title: You: ""Do you know the *Wirrâl Untethered..."
links.text: "Do you know the *Wirrâl Untethered* setting? I want a die for that."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Ah, yes, Fortress Accident." She s..."
links.text: "Ah, yes, Fortress Accident." She shakes her head lightly. "It's too bad they never finished their game..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""The Wirrâl Untethered die is a var..."
links.text: "The Wirrâl Untethered die is a variation of a standard role-playing die, only instead of plants it uses motifs of ice and death. And loss, of course."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Ice... death... loss... sounds like..."
links.text: Ice... death... loss... sounds like you.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I'm thinking something made from a..."
links.text: "I'm thinking something made from alligator jawbone, cast in black resin. The reptile bone is as white as ice and dead as... well... death," she smiles. "For seven reál I could have it ready in eight hours."

links.title: You: ""What's a *standard* role-playing d..."
links.text: "What's a *standard* role-playing die?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It's an *icositetrahedron* -- a 24..."
links.text: "It's an *icositetrahedron* -- a 24-sided die that can produce results for a 2-sided, 3-sided, 4-sided, 6-sided, and 12-sided die with a single roll. Technically you can also use it for many other sizes, but you may need to re-roll results."

links.title: Logic: "Loving it. So nifty."
links.text: Loving it. So nifty.

links.title: You: ""Why do you need to cast it in resi..."
links.text: "Why do you need to cast it in resin?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Untreated bone is porous and prone..."
links.text: "Untreated bone is porous and prone to chipping. Cast it in something hard like resin, though, and *voila*, it's perfect."

links.title: You: ""It's a deal." (Order the die.)"
links.text: "It's a deal." (Order the die.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Great! See you in eight hours then..."
links.text: "Great! See you in eight hours then." She takes a small notebook from her table and writes something down. "Was there anything else?"

links.title: You: ""Hm... I should maybe get a differe..."
links.text: "Hm... I should maybe get a different one." (Back off.)

links.title: You: ""Do you have any *cursed dice*?""
links.text: "Do you have any *cursed dice*?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""What do you mean by *cursed*?""
links.text: "What do you mean by *cursed*?"

links.title: You: ""As cursed as this commercial area.""
links.text: "As cursed as this commercial area."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Alright, how about I surprise you?..."
links.text: "Alright, how about I surprise you? Come back in eight hours with seven reál and I'll give you your *cursed die*."

links.title: You: ""It's a deal." (Order the die.)"
links.text: "It's a deal." (Order the die.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Great! See you in eight hours then..."
links.text: "Great! See you in eight hours then." She takes a small notebook from her table and writes something down. "Was there anything else?"

links.title: You: ""Actually, I need to think about it..."
links.text: "Actually, I need to think about it first." (Back off.)

links.title: You: ""As cursed as my life.""
links.text: "As cursed as my life."

links.title: You: ""Abraq-ad-abra, perished like this..."
links.text: "Abraq-ad-abra, perished like this world!"

links.title: You: ""Tell me about your most extraordin..."
links.text: "Tell me about your most extraordinary die!"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""A star that fell from the firmamen..."
links.text: "A star that fell from the firmament? Those cost more than seven reál. Are you sure?"

links.title: You: ""Yes, I'm a star myself, a *superst..."
links.text: "Yes, I'm a star myself, a *superstar* -- and superstars don't care about money."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Yes, you definitely have the prope..."
links.text: "Yes, you definitely have the proper attitude. How about a pair of 100-sided dice? Made of ivory and inlaid with lodestone, a naturally occurring magnet, to complement your magnetic personality."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Pieces of lodestone were used as th..."
links.text: Pieces of lodestone were used as the first magnetic compasses, from which they derive their other name: *course stones*.

links.title: Suggestion: "That's a stone for leaders."
links.text: That's a stone for leaders.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Ten reál and I can get these ready..."
links.text: "Ten reál and I can get these ready in eight hours."

links.title: You: ""But do magnetic dice even roll pro..."
links.text: "But do magnetic dice even roll properly?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It's true, magnetic dice are defin..."
links.text: "It's true, magnetic dice are definitely different. When rolled together, the magnetic fields of the pips interact with each other to push and pull on each other as they are rolled. Just like all magnetic personalities do."

links.title: You: ""It's a deal." (Order the dice set...."
links.text: "It's a deal." (Order the dice set.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Great! See you in eight hours then..."
links.text: "Great! See you in eight hours then." She takes a small notebook from her table and writes something down, her expression pleased. "Was there anything else?"

links.title: You: ""I need to think about it first." (..."
links.text: "I need to think about it first." (Back off.)

links.title: You: ""No, I'm afraid it's not worth it,..."
links.text: "No, I'm afraid it's not worth it, sorry."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Alright. Maybe some other die then?""
links.text: "Alright. Maybe some other die then?"

links.title: You: ""I'm sorry, I don't actually know w..."
links.text: "I'm sorry, I don't actually know what die I want..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""How about an amber die?" she sugge..."
links.text: "How about an amber die?" she suggests.

links.title: You: ""Amber, a poor man's gold?""
links.text: "Amber, a poor man's gold?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "The dicemaker laughs. "Who told you..."
links.text: The dicemaker laughs. "Who told you that amber was cheap? It's beautiful, really, and has been treasured since the ancient times."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""For seven reál I'll craft you a 13..."
links.text: "For seven reál I'll craft you a 13-sided die from a piece of amber with a fossilised insect. It's perfect for those who can't seem to let go of their past."

links.title: You: ""That sounds like me.""
links.text: "That sounds like me."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I had a feeling." She smiles, but..."
links.text: "I had a feeling." She smiles, but says nothing more.

links.title: You: ""It's a deal." (Order the die.)"
links.text: "It's a deal." (Order the die.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Great! See you in eight hours then..."
links.text: "Great! See you in eight hours then." She takes a small notebook from her table and writes something down. "Was there anything else?"

links.title: You: ""I need to think about it." (Back o..."
links.text: "I need to think about it." (Back off.)

links.title: You: ""No, amber sounds too boring.""
links.text: "No, amber sounds too boring."

links.title: You: ""Just a normal die for me, please...."
links.text: "Just a normal die for me, please. Very *regular*."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""A 'normal' die? I'm a novelty dice..."
links.text: "A 'normal' die? I'm a novelty dicemaker, I don't make 'normal' dice."

links.title: You: ""What do you do then?""
links.text: "What do you do then?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Polyhedral dice. Dice that have mo..."
links.text: "Polyhedral dice. Dice that have more than four sides. Octahedrons, trapezohedrons, dodecahedrons... But also barrel dice and teetotum balls."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Come on now. Be a little creative.""
links.text: "Come on now. Be a little creative."

links.title: You: ""I'm looking for something to help..."
links.text: "I'm looking for something to help with my work."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I think I have just the right one..."
links.text: "I think I have just the right one for you." She opens the top drawer of her work desk and takes something out -- two polyhedrons, red and blue, are cradled in her palm.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Police colours."
links.text: Police colours.

links.title: You: ""Because I'm a police officer, righ..."
links.text: "Because I'm a police officer, right?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Not the most original, I know," sh..."
links.text: "Not the most original, I know," she smiles, almost apologizing, "but sometimes the obvious choice is obvious because it's best."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Here, catch!" She tosses you the d..."
links.text: "Here, catch!" She tosses you the dice. "They're a gift from me."

links.title: You: ""Uh, I don't get it...""
links.text: "Uh, I don't get it..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""You're a police officer, right? He..."
links.text: "You're a police officer, right? Here, catch!" She tosses you the dice. "They're a gift from me."

links.title: Logic: "A beautiful woman tossing you a gif..."
links.text: A beautiful woman tossing you a gift? Whatever you do, don't overthink it.

links.title: You: "Catch the dice!"
links.text: Catch the dice!

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "Mr. Smooth Moves! You snatch the di..."
links.text: Mr. Smooth Moves! You snatch the dice out of the air with one hand, just like you're in a movie.

links.title: You: "Wink at the dicemaker."
links.text: Wink at the dicemaker.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""What are the odds?" The dicemaker..."
links.text: "What are the odds?" The dicemaker winks back at you. "The red one is made of bloodstone with a lapis lazuli inlay and the blue one is the inverse. I believe these dice are your lucky charm, officer..."

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "She winked back at you! Can you bel..."
links.text: She winked back at you! Can you believe it? You truly are Mr. Smooth Moves!

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""You'll definitely need luck in Mar..."
links.text: "You'll definitely need luck in Martinaise." She closes her desk drawer. "Was there anything else?"

links.title: You: "Say nothing. Act like you've done t..."
links.text: Say nothing. Act like you've done this a thousand times.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""What are the odds?" The dicemaker..."
links.text: "What are the odds?" The dicemaker gives you a warm smile. "The red one is made of bloodstone with a lapis lazuli inlay and the blue one is the inverse. Think of them as your lucky charm, officer..."

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "She smiled at you. She smiled! You..."
links.text: She smiled at you. She smiled! You truly are Mr. Smooth Moves!

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "You overthink it. Your hands can't..."
links.text: You overthink it. Your hands can't agree what to do and the two dice drop to the floor and scatter in opposite directions, like pearls from a broken string. The blue one disappears down the pit in the centre of the room...

links.title: You: "Let them fall on the ground."
links.text: Let them fall on the ground.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "Two tiny pieces of carved stone dro..."
links.text: Two tiny pieces of carved stone drop to the floor and scatter in opposite directions, like pearls from a broken string. The blue one disappears down the pit in the centre of the room...

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Ah, down the drain, like your care..."
links.text: "Ah, down the drain, like your career," jokes the dicemaker, her eyes tracking the remaining polyhedron. Then she catches your eye. "I apologize, officer. That comment was unnecessary."

links.title: You: ""I don't play fetch.""
links.text: "I don't play fetch."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Right." She tries to smile."
links.text: "Right." She tries to smile.

links.title: You: ""I'm not a dog.""
links.text: "I'm not a dog."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I see that.""
links.text: "I see that."

links.title: You: ""And I'm definitely not anyone's bi..."
links.text: "And I'm definitely not anyone's bitch."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "The dicemaker coughs, her hands pla..."
links.text: The dicemaker coughs, her hands playing with her ring again. She doesn't say a word.

links.title: You: "Pick up the red die."
links.text: Pick up the red die.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""That one is made of bloodstone wit..."
links.text: "That one is made of bloodstone with a lapis lazuli inlay. The other one was the inverse. They were a set, you see. But now the set is broken."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It's a shame. They might've have b..."
links.text: "It's a shame. They might've have brought you luck, and you'll definitely need luck in Martinaise." She closes her desk drawer.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Is she pitying you? Good god, she's..."
links.text: Is she pitying you? Good god, she's pitying you.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Now, was there anything else?""
links.text: "Now, was there anything else?"

links.title: You: "Leave the die on the floor."
links.text: Leave the die on the floor.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "Her knuckles pop audibly from her n..."
links.text: Her knuckles pop audibly from her nervous habit of playing with her hands. The soft chatter from the headphones continues unabated.

links.title: Authority: "That's right. You'll make your own..."
links.text: That's right. You'll make your own luck.

links.title: You: ""Actually, I need more time to thin..."
links.text: "Actually, I need more time to think about it."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""No need to rush. Take a look aroun..."
links.text: "No need to rush. Take a look around, see if anything inspires you." She nods towards the shelves full of precious stones.

links.title: You: ""What do you know about the man who..."
links.text: "What do you know about the man who was lynched behind the Whirling-in-Rags?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Nothing, really. I didn't know him.""
links.text: "Nothing, really. I didn't know him."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Who cares about the dead body? Ask..."
links.text: Who cares about the dead body? Ask her about the curse already!

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks at his noteboo..."
links.text: The lieutenant looks at his notebook, then the woman under the large window...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Your window looks directly onto th..."
links.text: "Your window looks directly onto the courtyard. You're saying you didn't see or hear *anything* unusual last Sunday evening?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I'm sorry, detective, but -- as yo..."
links.text: "I'm sorry, detective, but -- as you know -- I usually have my headphones on when I'm working. It shuts out most of the daily ruckus behind my window."

links.title: You: ""What do you mean by the 'daily ruc..."
links.text: "What do you mean by the 'daily ruckus'?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Well, there's always something goi..."
links.text: "Well, there's always something going on in the Whirling's backyard..." She stops to try and come up with an example.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""During daytime there are usually t..."
links.text: "During daytime there are usually those kids... And lately I've been seeing a lot of drunk workers hanging about. Must be because of the strike."

links.title: Drama: "She's heard of the murder, but did..."
links.text: She's heard of the murder, but did not see it, sire.

links.title: Empathy: "She's not sorry to disappoint you...."
links.text: She's not sorry to disappoint you. Informing on someone in a murder investigation would intrude upon her focused existence.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "She looks up at the window... Pale..."
links.text: She looks up at the window... Pale light comes in. "But I never saw anyone during that fateful Sunday night, I'm afraid."

links.title: You: ""And you never took your eyes off t..."
links.text: "And you never took your eyes off the work to look out of the window?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I might have," she admits, "but in..."
links.text: "I might have," she admits, "but in this case all I would have seen is my own reflection staring back from the darkness."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "It's light here -- but dark in the..."
links.text: It's light here -- but dark in the yard at night.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It's really hard to make anything..."
links.text: "It's really hard to make anything out in the yard when it's dark outside. Besides... I rarely get up to look out the window when I'm in the zone."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "This person values focus above all..."
links.text: This person values focus above all -- she keeps her sharp sight on the instruments before her.

links.title: You: ""Do you often work Sunday nights?""
links.text: "Do you often work Sunday nights?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It's an odd profession -- making d..."
links.text: "It's an odd profession -- making dice for people -- but I like it. And I *prefer* doing this to sitting at home."

links.title: You: ""I see. Thank you for your answers...."
links.text: "I see. Thank you for your answers." (Conclude.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "She nods."
links.text: She nods.

links.title: You: ""Seriously? You've got a great view..."
links.text: "Seriously? You've got a great view of the courtyard and you didn't see or hear *anything* Sunday night?"

links.title: You: ""Well, that settles that, then.""
links.text: "Well, that settles that, then."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Anything else, officer?""
links.text: "Anything else, officer?"

links.title: Inland Empire: "Who cares about the dead body? We m..."
links.text: Who cares about the dead body? We might be dealing with a *malignant entity* here!

links.title: You: ""Hey, where are we anyway? What is..."
links.text: "Hey, where are we anyway? What is this place?" (Look around the room.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""We're inside the chimney of an old..."
links.text: "We're inside the chimney of an old central furnace. It's strange, I know." She looks at the ruddy bricks that make up the walls -- even though they've been repainted there are still signs of coal-black soot here and there.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""But when I arrived here, all the o..."
links.text: "But when I arrived here, all the other rooms were taken, so I had to build myself a makeshift home. Besides, I don't really have to pay any rent here, so that's a plus."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Plaisance was right... There's an e..."
links.text: Plaisance was right... There's an entity living in the chimney! You should ask her about the curse.

links.title: Authority: "Does it mean she's *unlawfully* occ..."
links.text: Does it mean she's *unlawfully* occupying a part of the house? Shameful!

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Creative." The lieutenant looks ar..."
links.text: "Creative." The lieutenant looks around the spacious room, its ceiling fading into shadows above.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "When she arrived here, there was no..."
links.text: When she arrived here, there was no room anywhere else... She must've known the other businesses.

links.title: You: ""I've heard this place is cursed. D..."
links.text: "I've heard this place is cursed. Did you know that people call it the Doomed Commercial Area?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I've heard the stories," she nods,..."
links.text: "I've heard the stories," she nods, as the wind howls in from the furnace shaft above. "But I don't think those stories are true."

links.title: You: ""Wait... how do you explain what ha..."
links.text: "Wait... how do you explain what happened to all those companies then?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It's just capitalism." She shrugs...."
links.text: "It's just capitalism." She shrugs. "We only hear about tales of success, so it's often surprising to realize how many ventures actually fail."

links.title: You: ""Plaisance is the one who sent me...."
links.text: "Plaisance is the one who sent me. She's convinced that the place is swarming with malicious energies."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Plaisance, the bookshop lady?" She..."
links.text: "Plaisance, the bookshop lady?" She raises her brows. "I've heard that her business is doing rather well. Have the *energies* spared her somehow?"

links.title: You: ""Plaisance is a wise woman. She has..."
links.text: "Plaisance is a wise woman. She has Semenese trinkets protecting her against the curse."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Ah, the Semenese trinkets, of cour..."
links.text: "Ah, the Semenese trinkets, of course..." She nods as if this explains everything.

links.title: Rhetoric: "But it doesn't: this is merely a sa..."
links.text: But it doesn't: this is merely a sarcastic response.

links.title: You: ""Actually, the bookstore isn't doin..."
links.text: "Actually, the bookstore isn't doing that well. There are hardly any customers and she has to exploit her own daughter to keep the company going."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Alright. But it's not just the boo..."
links.text: "Alright. But it's not just the bookstore that's still up and running. What about the Whirling-in-Rags? Some people say it's part of the building complex."

links.title: You: ""Hold on, the Whirling is part of t..."
links.text: "Hold on, the Whirling is part of the Doomed Commercial Area?!"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""You could say so. Both houses were..."
links.text: "You could say so. Both houses were built at the same time and under the East Delta Commerce Centre project."

links.title: You: ""Yes, but it's still a separate bui..."
links.text: "Yes, but it's still a separate building. The malicious energies can't reach there."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""And then there's me..." She sighs,..."
links.text: "And then there's me..." She sighs, looking at her messy work table. All kinds of tools lie there scattered, from knives to carving files to wire cutters.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I've been here for 14 years, selli..."
links.text: "I've been here for 14 years, selling novelty dice to role-playing enthusiasts. Not exactly a million reál business idea, yet somehow I've survived despite the talk of malicious energies. Strange, isn't it?"

links.title: Half Light: "It's because she's in cahoots with..."
links.text: It's because she's in cahoots with the demons!

links.title: Drama: "Maybe it's just because she's so ta..."
links.text: Maybe it's just because she's so talented that she's been able to woo the curse?

links.title: You: ""Plaisance thinks it's because you'..."
links.text: "Plaisance thinks it's because you're the *source* of it. A malignant entity."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Malignant *entity*, what does that..."
links.text: "Malignant *entity*, what does that even mean?" The dicemaker laughs. "Some kind of sorceress? What about you, officer? Do you think I'm the *malignant entity*?"

links.title: Half Light: "The jig is up! The she-demon knows..."
links.text: The jig is up! The she-demon knows you've uncovered her true identity.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Time has come to face the Source. F..."
links.text: Time has come to face the Source. Fear not, for the forces of the universe are supporting you in this psychic quest.

links.title: You: ""I think it still might be *you* th..."
links.text: "I think it still might be *you* that's causing this." (Narrow your eyes -- very mysteriously.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Mm, so I'm the grand dragon in the..."
links.text: "Mm, so I'm the grand dragon in the cave..." She seems mildly entertained by this suggestion. "Might I ask what supports this claim?"

links.title: You: ""I yelled to summon the ghost of th..."
links.text: "I yelled to summon the ghost of the Doomed Commercial Area and you were the one who answered."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Oh my," she says in mock despair...."
links.text: "Oh my," she says in mock despair. "I've revealed myself!"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""You better call the exorcists.""
links.text: "You better call the exorcists."

links.title: You: ""I believe the name you're looking..."
links.text: "I believe the name you're looking for is the Remote Viewers Division."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""What's that? A union for clairvoya..."
links.text: "What's that? A union for clairvoyants? They have unions for everything nowadays."

links.title: You: ""No, it's a special division in the..."
links.text: "No, it's a special division in the police for investigating supra-natural activities."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "She just stares at you for a moment..."
links.text: She just stares at you for a moment with an astonished look on her face, blinking her dark eyes.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's not real, ma'am. He's making..."
links.text: "It's not real, ma'am. He's making it up."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Yes, I figured." She turns back to..."
links.text: "Yes, I figured." She turns back to you.

links.title: You: ""I don't have to call anyone, I'm a..."
links.text: "I don't have to call anyone, I'm a ghostwhisperer myself."

links.title: You: ""It is not my job to intervene in m..."
links.text: "It is not my job to intervene in matters supra-natural, for I am merely a police officer."

links.title: You: ""There is something ghostly about y..."
links.text: "There is something ghostly about you, *ethereal* even..." (Squint your eyes suspiciously.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""*Ethereal*?" She throws her head b..."
links.text: "*Ethereal*?" She throws her head back and laughs. "Thank you, but I think it's just the lighting."

links.title: Inland Empire: "No, it's the troubled colour of her..."
links.text: No, it's the troubled colour of her energetic vibrations!

links.title: You: ""No, I mean it -- your energetic vi..."
links.text: "No, I mean it -- your energetic vibrations are off. I sense tragedies in your past, darling."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Of course you do." She listens to..."
links.text: "Of course you do." She listens to your antics with a forbearing smile on her face. "Show me a person in Martinaise who *doesn't* have any tragedies in their past and then we'll talk."

links.title: You: "Let it go."
links.text: Let it go.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""If you ever find a way to explain..."
links.text: "If you ever find a way to explain all those *inconsistencies* in the curse then let me know." She turns back to her work.

links.title: You: ""You're the last man standing. You..."
links.text: "You're the last man standing. You must be responsible."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I *am* responsible for making soun..."
links.text: "I *am* responsible for making sound business decisions, yes, but not for my fellow tenants' misfortune."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Well, if you ever find a way to ex..."
links.text: "Well, if you ever find a way to explain all those *inconsistencies* in the curse then let me know." She turns back to her work.

links.title: Drama: "That's all she has to say on the su..."
links.text: That's all she has to say on the subject. She *has* been thorough -- and truthful -- as far as we can see.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Plaisance needs to hear about this...."
links.text: Plaisance needs to hear about this. Perhaps if you combine your *psychic energies* you'll make sense of the situation.

links.title: You: ""I don't have time for explanations..."
links.text: "I don't have time for explanations, not amidst all those *visions* I'm getting."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Of course." She pinches the root o..."
links.text: "Of course." She pinches the root of her nose. "How convenient."

links.title: You: ""I'm starting to see that there is..."
links.text: "I'm starting to see that there is no curse, only business decisions and natural market fluctuations."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Exactly." She pinches the root of..."
links.text: "Exactly." She pinches the root of her nose. "Truth is always so disappointingly mundane and boring."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""But I'm glad we got this sorted ou..."
links.text: "But I'm glad we got this sorted out. Anything else I can help you with today?"

links.title: Drama: "That's all she has to say on the su..."
links.text: That's all she has to say on the subject. She's been thorough and truthful as far as we can see.

links.title: Suggestion: "Plaisance is not going to like what..."
links.text: Plaisance is not going to like what you have to tell her.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "The bookstore closes starting 21.00..."
links.text: The bookstore closes starting 21.00. You'll have to do that tomorrow.

links.title: You: ""Honestly, I'm still not sure... Th..."
links.text: "Honestly, I'm still not sure... This world is a puzzling place."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Is it now?" She squints at you fro..."
links.text: "Is it now?" She squints at you from her desk. "I've always thought it's a rather mundane and boring place with no supra-natural surprises in sight."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Well, if you ever find a way to ex..."
links.text: "Well, if you ever find a way to explain all those *inconsistencies* in the curse, let me know." She turns back to her work.

links.title: You: ""It's because you're competent, and..."
links.text: "It's because you're competent, and dedicated to your craft. The curse doesn't affect people like you."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "The dicemaker erupts in laughter. "..."
links.text: The dicemaker erupts in laughter. "What, so the curse only affects people with poor work ethics? What you're describing isn't a *curse*, it's *capitalism*."

links.title: You: ""The curse will get to you, have no..."
links.text: "The curse will get to you, have no doubt about it. It just doesn't care about earthly time frames."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "The dicemaker erupts in laughter. "..."
links.text: The dicemaker erupts in laughter. "Is that what you think, officer? That the curse is real?"

links.title: You: ""I'll be the first to admit there a..."
links.text: "I'll be the first to admit there are many inconsistencies in this so-called 'curse'."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I was just about to ask..." She le..."
links.text: "I was just about to ask..." She leans forward in her chair to study your face. "What do *you* think? Do you think the curse is real?"

links.title: You: ""No, the Whirling isn't doing well..."
links.text: "No, the Whirling isn't doing well either: its waitress just took off and customers have trouble paying bills."

links.title: You: ""You're right, the Whirling doesn't..."
links.text: "You're right, the Whirling doesn't really look like it's cursed."

links.title: You: ""The curse is just biding its time..."
links.text: "The curse is just biding its time before it strikes again. Sooner or later everyone will fail -- even her."

links.title: You: ""I don't know why the bookstore has..."
links.text: "I don't know why the bookstore hasn't gone bankrupt yet -- that's what I'm here to investigate."

links.title: You: ""I have more questions about this b..."
links.text: "I have more questions about this building."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I'm listening.""
links.text: "I'm listening."

links.title: You: ""There used to be a hair salon here..."
links.text: "There used to be a hair salon here, right?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Yes, I think it was called Androgy..."
links.text: "Yes, I think it was called Androgynous Orlando or something similar. They weren't a big hit around here -- turns out that working class men don't like genderless haircuts. They're scared of that word."

links.title: Physical Instrument: "You wouldn't like it either. The ot..."
links.text: You wouldn't like it either. The others would laugh at you.

links.title: Conceptualization: "A bit of experimenting every now an..."
links.text: A bit of experimenting every now and then isn't bad.

links.title: Composure: "It's not about the haircut, it's ab..."
links.text: It's not about the haircut, it's about the *confidence*.

links.title: You: ""What's wrong with a bit of experim..."
links.text: "What's wrong with a bit of experimenting? The customers should have been more open-minded."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I guess it just wasn't the time ye..."
links.text: "I guess it just wasn't the time yet." She tucks a strand of hair under the headscarf.

links.title: You: ""I would *never* let anyone androgy..."
links.text: "I would *never* let anyone androgynous touch my hair, not even if my life depended on it."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""You're right, it looks like you ha..."
links.text: "You're right, it looks like you haven't let anyone near your hair in a long time." She tilts her head, looking at your shaggy mane.

links.title: Authority: "She's right -- when was the last ti..."
links.text: She's right -- when was the last time? You should get an un-androgynous crew cut.

links.title: You: ""I guess I'm a simple man, I don't..."
links.text: "I guess I'm a simple man, I don't really have any opinions on hair styles."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Me neither. I just want it off my..."
links.text: "Me neither. I just want it off my face." She tucks a strand of hair under her headscarf.

links.title: You: ""What happened to the gym?""
links.text: "What happened to the gym?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It wasn't merely a gym, it was *Ar..."
links.text: "It wasn't merely a gym, it was *Artemitep's Boxing Club* -- a community project created to steer at-risk youths away from drugs and crime."

links.title: You: ""And who was Artemitep?""
links.text: "And who was Artemitep?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""A kind man... from Zsiemsk. I hear..."
links.text: "A kind man... from Zsiemsk. I heard he had some trouble with the law when he was younger, and that's why he wanted to start the gym, as his way of giving back."

links.title: You: ""Maybe that's what Cuno needs -- a..."
links.text: "Maybe that's what Cuno needs -- a community-centric boxing club."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Hm, Cuno." Her eyes narrow in the..."
links.text: "Hm, Cuno." Her eyes narrow in the dim light. "Who's Cuno?"

links.title: You: ""He's sort of the king around here.""
links.text: "He's sort of the king around here."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Oh, yes -- you mean the kid with t..."
links.text: "Oh, yes -- you mean the kid with the sailor's mouth? Yes, I've heard him yelling profanities in the backyard..." She looks out of the window; it's oddly quiet there at the moment.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I think it will take more than a g..."
links.text: "I think it will take more than a gym to help that kid."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Oh, you mean the kid with the sail..."
links.text: "Oh, you mean the kid with the sailor's mouth. Yes, I've heard him yelling profanities in the backyard..." She looks out of the window, her face reflecting back in the dark.

links.title: You: ""He's a little ginger gremlin who l..."
links.text: "He's a little ginger gremlin who likes to defile dead bodies."

links.title: You: ""Indeed, who *is* Cuno... Your gues..."
links.text: "Indeed, who *is* Cuno... Your guess is as good as mine."

links.title: You: ""How did that community project wor..."
links.text: "How did that community project work out?" (Conclude.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It didn't. If anything, it made th..."
links.text: "It didn't. If anything, it made the youth situation in Martinaise even worse. At some point, someone started a rumour that the punching bag downstairs was full of *amphetamines*."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "You should've known it!"
links.text: You should've known it!

links.title: Logic: "It's not really full of that. No on..."
links.text: It's not really full of that. No one would store their drugs like that.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Eventually the Coalition took away..."
links.text: "Eventually the Coalition took away the funding and the club went bankrupt. This was a few years ago. It's gotten much more peaceful around the plaza ever since."

links.title: You: ""Judging from the kids I've met so..."
links.text: "Judging from the kids I've met so far, it didn't really work, did it?" (Conclude.)

links.title: You: ""What's up with the broken windows?""
links.text: "What's up with the broken windows?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Oh, this one's a mess." She sighs...."
links.text: "Oh, this one's a mess." She sighs. "There used to be a company that promised to repair windows 24 hours a day. What could go wrong with this one, right?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Turns out the business was actuall..."
links.text: "Turns out the business was actually set up as a front for an illicit group that was producing *snuff milieus* -- who would have guessed..."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Hm, what's a snuff milieu?"
links.text: Hm, what's a snuff milieu?

links.title: Half Light: "Trust me, you don't want to know."
links.text: Trust me, you don't want to know.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""And they never cleaned up the debr..."
links.text: "And they never cleaned up the debris either. Now it's just littering the hallway and I have no idea how to get rid of it on my own."

links.title: You: ""Cool, very cool about the debris -..."
links.text: "Cool, very cool about the debris -- but what's a *snuff milieu*?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It's a sub rosa radio station that..."
links.text: "It's a sub rosa radio station that broadcasts real murders, with real victims. Some people pay good money to get off on it."

links.title: Drama: "Nothing changes in her tone as she..."
links.text: Nothing changes in her tone as she says that -- as if it's just another piece of information to lay out for the world.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "What does she mean -- to *get off*..."
links.text: What does she mean -- to *get off* on it?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Don't worry, the ICP has a separat..."
links.text: "Don't worry, the ICP has a separate division that deals exclusively with unlicensed sub rosas," the lieutenant turns to you. "This isn't our problem."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Good luck with that. It's not easy..."
links.text: "Good luck with that. It's not easy catching those perpetrators." Then she lets the thought go.

links.title: You: ""Wait, people do that?""
links.text: "Wait, people do that?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""People do that," she nods. "I beli..."
links.text: "People do that," she nods. "I believe the ICP got them. They have a special division that deals exclusively with sub rosas."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "It's the copopedia reporting in: IC..."
links.text: It's the copopedia reporting in: ICP stands for International Collaboration Police.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""In any case, I don't think it's yo..."
links.text: "In any case, I don't think it's your job to worry about what happens on milieus. I probably shouldn't have even mentioned it -- things like that are better forgotten."

links.title: You: ""That's horrible. Were they arreste..."
links.text: "That's horrible. Were they arrested?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I believe the ICP got them. They h..."
links.text: "I believe the ICP got them. They have a special division that deals exclusively with sub rosas."

links.title: You: ""I don't want hear about this sick..."
links.text: "I don't want hear about this sick shit anymore."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Good call." She lets the thought g..."
links.text: "Good call." She lets the thought go.

links.title: You: ""It's a shame about those windows...."
links.text: "It's a shame about those windows. I'm not even going to ask about that milieu..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Yeah, don't." She looks down, then..."
links.text: "Yeah, don't." She looks down, then up again.

links.title: You: ""Did someone here make stuffed anim..."
links.text: "Did someone here make stuffed animals? I saw mounts lying around."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""You mean Mr. Fabron, the taxidermi..."
links.text: "You mean Mr. Fabron, the taxidermist? No, he mostly just did drugs."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "But *what* drugs exactly?"
links.text: But *what* drugs exactly?

links.title: You: ""I need to know what drugs he was d..."
links.text: "I need to know what drugs he was doing... for my... police report."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""He got high on some weird taxiderm..."
links.text: "He got high on some weird taxidermy chemicals... I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Eventually they caused him to lose control of his bladder. The smell was awful."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Even you can probably do better tha..."
links.text: Even you can probably do better than that.

links.title: Empathy: "You can almost see it -- a small, s..."
links.text: You can almost see it -- a small, sickly old man hunched behind his work desk, his pants stained with old piss, stuffing a sad stiff-legged raccoon dog. The entire scene looks tragic.

links.title: You: "Let it pass."
links.text: Let it pass.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Anything else?""
links.text: "Anything else?"

links.title: You: ""I found creepy mannequins...""
links.text: "I found creepy mannequins..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""There used to be a fashion atelier..."
links.text: "There used to be a fashion atelier here, but I have forgotten the head designer's name... They were doing well for a couple of years, until the insect rights activists came."

links.title: You: ""Insect rights activists? What in t..."
links.text: "Insect rights activists? What in the name of..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Mhmh -- the atelier produced a cer..."
links.text: "Mhmh -- the atelier produced a certain collection that used chitin among the materials. Apparently chitin is made in the Occident, where it's extracted from beetle wings."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""And you know how all kinds of poli..."
links.text: "And you know how all kinds of political movements are *big* in the Occident. The activists shut down the biggest chitin suppliers, which of course caused the price to skyrocket."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""And -- naturally -- all the most f..."
links.text: "And -- naturally -- all the most fashionable tastemakers refused to be seen in chitin from then on. The atelier went bankrupt before they could finish the collection."

links.title: You: ""I'm glad that someone took care of..."
links.text: "I'm glad that someone took care of the little guys. I like insects." (Nod.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Hm. Really?" She looks at the wind..."
links.text: "Hm. Really?" She looks at the windowsill, where a dead fly is lying on its back, legs curled up in a bowtie. "Anyway..."

links.title: Empathy: "Poor guy... suddenly you get a feel..."
links.text: Poor guy... suddenly you get a feeling that insects are important to the case somehow. It's hard to say why.

links.title: You: ""But insects don't have any... brai..."
links.text: "But insects don't have any... brains or... feelings."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Actually, insects *do* have brains..."
links.text: "Actually, insects *do* have brains," she corrects you. "But yes, I understand what you're saying. I think the protesters took it a little too far."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "As she shifts around, you notice se..."
links.text: As she shifts around, you notice several dead flies on the windowsill in front of her. Legs up, they're not moving.

links.title: You: ""They got what they deserved -- mak..."
links.text: "They got what they deserved -- making clothes out of beetle wings is a *terrible* idea!"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""At least it had some spark to it...."
links.text: "At least it had some spark to it. Most young designers just combine lace with leather and call it original." She shifts in her simple workwear shirt.

links.title: You: ""I didn't know insects had any righ..."
links.text: "I didn't know insects had any rights -- or activists."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Yeah, the atelier didn't know it e..."
links.text: "Yeah, the atelier didn't know it either. They produced a certain collection that used chitin among the materials. Apparently chitin is made in the Occident, where it's extracted from beetle wings."

links.title: You: ""What's with the rotor blades and s..."
links.text: "What's with the rotor blades and skis?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""They were made by a company called..."
links.text: "They were made by a company called Slipstream. After they 'pivoted' from making rotor blades to skis, their chief executive took off on a 'vacation'... with all their money." She rests her chin on her hand with an impish smile.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Honestly, I think it's quite funny..."
links.text: "Honestly, I think it's quite funny. I think he's still sending out holiday transmissions from Touloula or Tioumoutiri or Khasht-Kor, or wherever he is."

links.title: You: "(Look at your feet.) "Unhonourable...."
links.text: (Look at your feet.) "Unhonourable..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Maybe." She doesn't really seem to..."
links.text: "Maybe." She doesn't really seem to care that much about honour. "But Slipsteam's history now. All their remaining assets got seized by the bailiffs in '47."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I have no idea why those skis and..."
links.text: "I have no idea why those skis and blades are still lying around in the house... Not much use now, I guess."

links.title: You: ""Interesting. What do these transmi..."
links.text: "Interesting. What do these transmissions say?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""The usual, I imagine -- that he's..."
links.text: "The usual, I imagine -- that he's been thinking up all kinds of new business plans and can't *wait* to get *started* on them just as soon as he returns..." Her smile widens, before she sees the lieutenant's face behind you.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Men like that are a curse." The li..."
links.text: "Men like that are a curse." The lieutenant is stern.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Sure. But Slipstream is history no..."
links.text: "Sure. But Slipstream is history now. All their remaining assets got seized by the bailiffs in '47."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""The usual, I imagine -- that he's..."
links.text: "The usual, I imagine -- that he's been thinking up all kinds of new business plans and can't *wait* to get *started* on them just as soon as he returns..." She laughs and turns around in her chair.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""But Slipstream is history now. All..."
links.text: "But Slipstream is history now. All their remaining assets got seized by the bailiffs in '47. I have no idea why those skis and blades are still lying around in the house..."

links.title: You: ""That's illegal -- running off with..."
links.text: "That's illegal -- running off with company's money like that. Why hasn't he been arrested?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Sure, it's illegal, but it's not e..."
links.text: "Sure, it's illegal, but it's not exactly anything *extraordinary* in business. Besides, Slipstream is history now. All their remaining assets got seized by the bailiffs in '47. I have no idea why those skis and blades are still lying around."

links.title: Logic: "They were just props. Why return to..."
links.text: They were just props. Why return to them?

links.title: Interfacing: "Maybe you could make a sword out of..."
links.text: Maybe you could make a sword out of one... No, wait, forget it. It would take too long.

links.title: You: ""I found a strange machine...""
links.text: "I found a strange machine..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Fortress Accident, the radio game..."
links.text: "Fortress Accident, the radio game studio..." She closes her eyes as some remnant of a memory lights up her face.

links.title: Empathy: "She liked them."
links.text: She liked them.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""They were an interesting bunch. We..."
links.text: "They were an interesting bunch. We talked about role-playing systems every now and then. Once I even saw two of them get into fisticuffs over Wirrâl..."

links.title: Conceptualization: "That's understandable. Fantasies ar..."
links.text: That's understandable. Fantasies are serious things. The mind is the drawing board of history.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""They certainly took their work ver..."
links.text: "They certainly took their work very seriously. Even if they seemed to be... chronically *liberal* with their schedules."

links.title: You: ""What do you mean *liberal*? What h..."
links.text: "What do you mean *liberal*? What happened?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""The usual. They ran out of money a..."
links.text: "The usual. They ran out of money and couldn't get the project done on time."

links.title: You: ""What went wrong?""
links.text: "What went wrong?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Well, I did hear them talking at t..."
links.text: "Well, I did hear them talking at times..." She looks at the hallway, as if she can still hear them chit-chat behind her curtains on a cigarette break.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""They seemed to believe they were h..."
links.text: "They seemed to believe they were historical individuals on some *grand* quest."

links.title: Drama: "She sounds almost mocking when she..."
links.text: She sounds almost mocking when she says that.

links.title: You: ""From what I've seen so far the pro..."
links.text: "From what I've seen so far the project *did* look quite impressive..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Yes, but when the money started to..."
links.text: "Yes, but when the money started to run out they just began to complain a lot about capitalism. You know, how the markets are *rigged* to keep out new businesses, and so on."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""In the end they just didn't get it..."
links.text: "In the end they just didn't get it done. They didn't have enough willpower to produce something *truly historic* -- and to show up to work on time."

links.title: Authority: "She's right, showing up to work on..."
links.text: She's right, showing up to work on time is important.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Showing up to work on time is *hard..."
links.text: Showing up to work on time is *hard* -- no, scratch that, showing up to work *at all* is difficult (especially if you've been drinking).

links.title: You: ""Well, showing up to work on time *..."
links.text: "Well, showing up to work on time *is* incredibly hard."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""And so is producing something extr..."
links.text: "And so is producing something extraordinary." Her eyes wander to the shelves full of die prototypes and discarded models.

links.title: Empathy: "Something strains her face, before..."
links.text: Something strains her face, before she looks up again:

links.title: You: ""That's too bad. I would have suppo..."
links.text: "That's too bad. I would have supported them -- the project looked great."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Not the wisest decision: You would..."
links.text: "Not the wisest decision: You would have lost all your savings." She tosses a pair of dice on the table; one of them stops near the edge of the metallic desk.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "The result is 1. On a 20-sided die."
links.text: The result is 1. On a 20-sided die.

links.title: Inland Empire: "The dice is black and filled with l..."
links.text: The dice is black and filled with little silvery flakes, like snowfall.

links.title: You: ""You're right, they should have jus..."
links.text: "You're right, they should have just tried harder. They had everything needed to succeed."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Still, not everyone is going to ma..."
links.text: "Still, not everyone is going to make it." She tosses a pair of dice on the table; one of them stops near the edge of the metallic desk. "That's the nature of the game."

links.title: You: ""Really? They must have been on a g..."
links.text: "Really? They must have been on a gigantic ego trip."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""That's what I thought. Because whe..."
links.text: "That's what I thought. Because when the money started to run out they just began to complain a lot about capitalism. You know, how the markets are rigged to keep out new businesses, and so on."

links.title: You: ""I heard that they ran out of money.""
links.text: "I heard that they ran out of money."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Money and time," she nods. "The us..."
links.text: "Money and time," she nods. "The usual."

links.title: You: ""They had some kind of an accident..."
links.text: "They had some kind of an accident with the backup copy, right?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""An accident? I wouldn't know anyth..."
links.text: "An accident? I wouldn't know anything about that. I just heard they ran out of money and couldn't get the project done on time."

links.title: You: ""I met one of their investors. He s..."
links.text: "I met one of their investors. He said they lacked the will to finish anything."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Ha, the salty investors..." Someth..."
links.text: "Ha, the salty investors..." Something green sparkles in her eyes. "Well yes, they couldn't get the project done on time and thus lost the funding."

links.title: You: ""There was a terrifying taxidermied..."
links.text: "There was a terrifying taxidermied bear in the cellar."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Oh boy, the fabled Revachol Ice Ci..."
links.text: "Oh boy, the fabled Revachol Ice City -- you're in for a treat here!" She smiles and leans closer, hands on her knees, like a stand-up comedian ready to tell a story.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""The place was owned by two guys wh..."
links.text: "The place was owned by two guys who had some rather *innovative* ideas about marketing. The bear was one of them. Now, ask me about their *other* ideas."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Indeed, what were the other ideas?"
links.text: Indeed, what were the other ideas?

links.title: You: ""Alright, what about the other idea..."
links.text: "Alright, what about the other ideas?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""There was really just one, and it..."
links.text: "There was really just one, and it involved picking out the prettiest girls in the neighbourhood and paying them 20 cents per hour to man the booth."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""And by 'man the booth' I mean 'slu..."
links.text: "And by 'man the booth' I mean 'slump behind the counter with a face that could maim you if you ever dared to disturb their bored magazine-browsing.'" She leans back, disapproving.

links.title: Suggestion: "Sounds like she really didn't like..."
links.text: Sounds like she really didn't like those girls.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Sounds like she really doesn't know..."
links.text: Sounds like she really doesn't know how to be a female ally!

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Frittte does the same thing."
links.text: Frittte does the same thing.

links.title: You: ""I know a girl just like that. She..."
links.text: "I know a girl just like that. She works in Frittte as a cashier and she's not particularly friendly."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Employing sulky teenage girls is a..."
links.text: "Employing sulky teenage girls is a widespread practice, yes. Unfortunately they always come in packs -- I'm talking about acne-ridden *girlfriends* and gorilla-like *boyfriends* loitering near the shop. At least that's what happened with Revachol Ice City."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""And they already had *the bear*......"
links.text: "And they already had *the bear*..." She closes her eyes as if remembering something painful.

links.title: You: ""What about the bear?""
links.text: "What about the bear?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""*The bear*..." she repeats, pressi..."
links.text: "*The bear*..." she repeats, pressing thumbs into her temples, like trying to suppress a headache.

links.title: You: ""It didn't work out?""
links.text: "It didn't work out?"

links.title: You: ""You should learn how to *support*..."
links.text: "You should learn how to *support* other women, not bring them down."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I'm not talking just about *women*..."
links.text: "I'm not talking just about *women*. There were also *men* -- miniature gorilla-like *boyfriends* loitering near the ice cream stand."

links.title: You: ""What did they expect? Twenty cents..."
links.text: "What did they expect? Twenty cents per hour is dog's pay. I'm surprised they showed up to work at all."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Oh, but they did -- they did show..."
links.text: "Oh, but they did -- they did show up to work, and not alone. There were also acne-ridden *girlfriends* and gorilla-like *boyfriends* loitering near the ice cream stand."

links.title: You: ""That's an award-winning idea! How..."
links.text: "That's an award-winning idea! How else do you choose people around you?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Yes, some people spend their whole..."
links.text: "Yes, some people spend their whole lives chasing the 'hot one'." She makes quotation marks with her fingers. "You should have joined the gorilla-like boyfriends loitering near the stand, ready to scare off customers and hit on the girls."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""As if they didn't already have *th..."
links.text: "As if they didn't already have *the bear*..." She closes her eyes as if remembering something painful.

links.title: You: ""I don't have an opinion on employi..."
links.text: "I don't have an opinion on employing teens, I just want to know -- did it work out for the business?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It didn't. Occasionally the girls..."
links.text: "It didn't. Occasionally the girls had their friends over, which doubled the amount of hairspray, skin problems, and mood swings behind the counter."

links.title: You: ""I don't care about their other ide..."
links.text: "I don't care about their other ideas, I just want to hear about the bear. Did the bear work?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Of course not. The bear was terrif..."
links.text: "Of course not. The bear was terrifying. No one wants ice-cream *guarded* by a hostile apex predator. To make matters worse, the fridge didn't work too well either, and half the ice cream came out malformed and partially melted."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Eventually Revachol Ice City lost..."
links.text: "Eventually Revachol Ice City lost a price war to its rival, Glacé 5000. Glacé 5000 sold caramel sundaes for only five cents a piece. Out of regular fridges."

links.title: You: "(Nod solemnly.) "It's the market do..."
links.text: (Nod solemnly.) "It's the market doing its job."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Maybe. Because the taxidermist who..."
links.text: "Maybe. Because the taxidermist who made the bear definitely wasn't. Doing his job, I mean."

links.title: You: ""How come?""
links.text: "How come?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""He said that the bear was his *vis..."
links.text: "He said that the bear was his *vision beast*. He said he met his *vision beast* while high on desiccants. He called it 'Megatherion.'"

links.title: You: ""I'm sure the bear was doing its be..."
links.text: "I'm sure the bear was doing its best."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Maybe. Because the taxidermist who..."
links.text: "Maybe. Because the taxidermist who made that bear definitely wasn't. Doing his best, I mean."

links.title: You: ""The bear was scary. Every time I s..."
links.text: "The bear was scary. Every time I saw that bear I felt *scared*, like it could become alive any moment now."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""The taxidermist who made it said i..."
links.text: "The taxidermist who made it said it was his *vision beast*. He said he met his *vision beast* while high on desiccants. He called it 'Megatherion'."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Sounds cool."
links.text: Sounds cool.

links.title: Half Light: "Scary... but *cool*."
links.text: Scary... but *cool*.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Why is *everyone* doing drugs in th..."
links.text: Why is *everyone* doing drugs in this place -- even the *taxidermist*?!

links.title: You: ""Megatherion?""
links.text: "Megatherion?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Megatherion," nods the dicemaker,..."
links.text: "Megatherion," nods the dicemaker, "a mega wild beast."

links.title: You: ""What's a mega wild beast?""
links.text: "What's a mega wild beast?"

links.title: You: ""What's a vision beast?""
links.text: "What's a vision beast?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It's an imaginary beast that guide..."
links.text: "It's an imaginary beast that guides you through life..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""...by telling you to do more drugs..."
links.text: "...by telling you to do more drugs, mostly."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Maybe this wise and noble beast can..."
links.text: Maybe this wise and noble beast can guide you toward those *amphetamines* you've been craving.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "The horrific necktie tightens aroun..."
links.text: The horrific necktie tightens around your neck, strangely excited... But it doesn't feel particularly *fun* this time around.

links.title: You: ""I don't do drugs.""
links.text: "I don't do drugs."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Very good, you shouldn't do them,"..."
links.text: "Very good, you shouldn't do them," nods the dicemaker. "You're a police officer, after all..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Anyway, now you know the story of..."
links.text: "Anyway, now you know the story of the fallen ice cream empire." She seems almost sad, finishing the story.

links.title: Shivers: "The temperature has dropped in the..."
links.text: The temperature has dropped in the cover of the night; you see frost on the windows.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Anything else? Another failed busi..."
links.text: "Anything else? Another failed business perhaps? I've been here for a long time..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Anyway, now you know the story of..."
links.text: "Anyway, now you know the story of the fallen ice cream empire." She seems almost sad, finishing the story. Some dust beams swirl in the afternoon air. Her eyes follow it idly.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Little sparkling embers under the w..."
links.text: Little sparkling embers under the window...

links.title: Shivers: "Outside it's light. Light scatters..."
links.text: Outside it's light. Light scatters from the low hanging cloud cover. There's always the threat of snow.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Anyway, now you know the story of..."
links.text: "Anyway, now you know the story of the fallen ice cream empire." She seems almost sad, finishing the story. Some dust beams swirl in the morning light. Her eyes follow it idly.

links.title: You: ""I do drugs. I've got a vision beas..."
links.text: "I do drugs. I've got a vision beast myself."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Do you?" The dicemaker raises an e..."
links.text: "Do you?" The dicemaker raises an eyebrow. "Well, good luck keeping it under control..."

links.title: You: ""I don't have a comment on drugs.""
links.text: "I don't have a comment on drugs."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Understandable. You shouldn't do t..."
links.text: "Understandable. You shouldn't do them," nods the dicemaker. "You're a police officer, after all..."

links.title: You: ""Hey, do you think that vision beas..."
links.text: "Hey, do you think that vision beast could guide me toward some *amphetamines*?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I don't, officer. You should stay..."
links.text: "I don't, officer. You should stay away from drugs, and vision beasts..."

links.title: You: "(Grab your necktie and mumble.) "No..."
links.text: (Grab your necktie and mumble.) "Not... now... you beast!"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""What?""
links.text: "What?"

links.title: You: ""Do you ever feel like your vision..."
links.text: "Do you ever feel like your vision beast is trying to *blackmail* the fun out of you?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""No, officer. I don't have a vision..."
