links.text: "No, officer. I don't have a vision beast."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Normal people don't have vision be..."
links.text: "Normal people don't have vision beasts. Only drug-addled madmen like the taxidermist do."

links.title: You: ""That was a hypothetical question.""
links.text: "That was a hypothetical question."

links.title: You: ""Of course they don't. I'm a normal..."
links.text: "Of course they don't. I'm a normal person and I don't have a vision beast."

links.title: You: ""What about horrific neckties? Do n..."
links.text: "What about horrific neckties? Do normal people have horrific neckties?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Neckties?" Her eyes move to the pi..."
links.text: "Neckties?" Her eyes move to the piss-coloured cloth tied around your neck. "I guess they do sometimes, officer... But I don't understand how it's relevant to our discussion."

links.title: You: ""Nothing!" (Cough and let go of the..."
links.text: "Nothing!" (Cough and let go of the tie.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Right," says the dicemaker. She do..."
links.text: "Right," says the dicemaker. She doesn't look entirely convinced.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "A wise and noble beast, guiding you..."
links.text: A wise and noble beast, guiding you toward the land where the streets are paved... with drugs!

links.title: You: ""Very cool, but I don't want to hea..."
links.text: "Very cool, but I don't want to hear about bears anymore. Let's move on."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Oh, I totally understand.""
links.text: "Oh, I totally understand."

links.title: You: ""I killed the bear." (You unplugged..."
links.text: "I killed the bear." (You unplugged it.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""You did *what*?" She rolls her swi..."
links.text: "You did *what*?" She rolls her swivel chair an inch closer to you, unsure whether she heard you right.

links.title: You: ""I had to kill the bear to *become*..."
links.text: "I had to kill the bear to *become* the bear."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I can see," she nods, pointing to..."
links.text: "I can see," she nods, pointing to your war-paint, "the stripes."

links.title: You: ""The bear put up quite a fight.""
links.text: "The bear put up quite a fight."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""That bear was one mighty mammal. T..."
links.text: "That bear was one mighty mammal. The taxidermist who made it said it was his *vision beast*. He said he met his *vision beast* while high on desiccants. He called it 'Megatherion.'"

links.title: You: ""Those stripes are what keeps me hu..."
links.text: "Those stripes are what keeps me human."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I can see," she nods, eyeing you u..."
links.text: "I can see," she nods, eyeing you up and down.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""The taxidermist who made it said i..."
links.text: "The taxidermist who made it said it was his *vision beast*. He said he met his *vision beast* while high on desiccants. He called it 'Megatherion.'"

links.title: You: ""I murdered it. With my own bare ha..."
links.text: "I murdered it. With my own bare hands I laid it to rest. It's my trophy now."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Really? You broke it? What a shame..."
links.text: "Really? You broke it? What a shame. It was a *terrifying* beast, but I was fond of it."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""The taxidermist who made it said i..."
links.text: "The taxidermist who made it said it was his *vision beast*. He said he met his *vision beast* while high on desiccants. He called it 'Megatherion.'"

links.title: You: ""I unplugged the fridge to help Rev..."
links.text: "I unplugged the fridge to help Revachol Ice City cut their losses."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Ah, of course they left it plugged..."
links.text: "Ah, of course they left it plugged in. Even in death the bear is costing them money."

links.title: You: ""I have more questions about the in..."
links.text: "I have more questions about the intercom."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I'm pretty sure it still doesn't w..."
links.text: "I'm pretty sure it still doesn't work, but sure, what do you want to know?"

links.title: You: ""So you're telling me that you have..."
links.text: "So you're telling me that you have a doorbell there -- which one?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""The one with an empty name card, i..."
links.text: "The one with an empty name card, it's the last one in the list. As I said, it's quite useless right now, it doesn't work yet."

links.title: You: ""So you're telling me that the door..."
links.text: "So you're telling me that the doorbell with the empty name card was yours?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""That's right, I haven't even writt..."
links.text: "That's right, I haven't even written my name there -- as I said, it's quite useless right now, it doesn't work yet."

links.title: You: ""I was wondering about the Whirling..."
links.text: "I was wondering about the Whirling-in-Rags. Is it part of the same building complex?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""You could say so. Both houses were..."
links.text: "You could say so. Both houses were built at the same time and under the East Delta Commerce Centre project. That explains why you can call the Whirling from the intercom, albeit I doubt that anyone responds."

links.title: Inland Empire: "If the Whirling is part of the same..."
links.text: If the Whirling is part of the same building then it's part of the Doomed Commercial Area. The darkness of this place is there too...

links.title: You: ""I saw a name 'East Delta Pinball'..."
links.text: "I saw a name 'East Delta Pinball' on the doorbell."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Right, it used to be a gaming arca..."
links.text: "Right, it used to be a gaming arcade. This is an *ancient* failure -- before my time. I'm not surprised, however."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""My advice..." She raises her finge..."
links.text: "My advice..." She raises her finger. "Don't base your business on a fad -- hypnotism, floriography, triktrak, especially *pinball*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Agreed," the lieutenant chips in,..."
links.text: "Agreed," the lieutenant chips in, "pinball is the worst."

links.title: Empathy: "His disdain for pinball could not b..."
links.text: His disdain for pinball could not be clearer.

links.title: You: ""East Delta Pinball -- is that now..."
links.text: "East Delta Pinball -- is that now the Whirling?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Yes. I guess so. The arcade is an..."
links.text: "Yes. I guess so. The arcade is an *ancient* failure -- before my time. I'm not surprised, however."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""My advice..." She raises her finge..."
links.text: "My advice..." She raises her finger. "Don't base your business on a fad -- hypnotism, floriography, triktrak, especially *pinball*."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Yes. I've heard it used to be a ga..."
links.text: "Yes. I've heard it used to be a gaming arcade. This is an *ancient* failure -- before my time. I'm not surprised, however."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "You know... this is something the C..."
links.text: You know... this is something the Cafeteria Manager might want to know.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""My advice..." She raises her finge..."
links.text: "My advice..." She raises her finger. "Don't base your business on a fad -- hypnotism, floriography, triktrak, especially *pinball*..."

links.title: You: ""This means the Whirling is part of..."
links.text: "This means the Whirling is part of the *Doomed Commercial Area*. Garte is gonna *love* this..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I don't know this Garte -- but som..."
links.text: "I don't know this Garte -- but something tells me he won't."

links.title: You: "Keep it to yourself."
links.text: Keep it to yourself.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Anything else I can help you with?""
links.text: "Anything else I can help you with?"

links.title: You: ""A strange thing happened when I tr..."
links.text: "A strange thing happened when I tried calling a company named Slipstream SCA -- someone answered."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "She looks like she doesn't really b..."
links.text: She looks like she doesn't really believe you. "It can't be true. They don't work here anymore, they've been gone for *years*."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Are you sure it was Slipstream SCA..."
links.text: "Are you sure it was Slipstream SCA? Was it a *woman*? Maybe it was Plaisance from the bookstore..."

links.title: You: ""First, it wasn't Plaisance, I know..."
links.text: "First, it wasn't Plaisance, I know her and would have recognized her voice."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Alright. But did this person say a..."
links.text: "Alright. But did this person say anything?" She still sounds sceptical.

links.title: You: ""She said she was from Tricentennia..."
links.text: "She said she was from Tricentennial Electrics."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Tricentennial Electrics?" There's..."
links.text: "Tricentennial Electrics?" There's a moment before she recognizes the name.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It used to be a major electric com..."
links.text: "It used to be a major electric company one hundred years ago. Are you sure it wasn't just some kids playing a prank on you?"

links.title: Inland Empire: "No, it was something else... It was..."
links.text: No, it was something else... It was *eerie*.

links.title: Drama: "It was too real to be just a prank...."
links.text: It was too real to be just a prank. Either we're dealing with a professional actress, or...

links.title: Composure: "Whatever happened, keep your cool...."
links.text: Whatever happened, keep your cool. It's probably better to admit that it was a harmless prank.

links.title: You: ""You're right, I probably just got..."
links.text: "You're right, I probably just got made fun of."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""The kids these days..." She shakes..."
links.text: "The kids these days..." She shakes her head. "We were just one of them and now they're terrorizing us. No solidarity."

links.title: You: ""No, it was something else -- somet..."
links.text: "No, it was something else -- something *eerie*..." (Narrow your eyes.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Pranks can be eerie." She looks as..."
links.text: "Pranks can be eerie." She looks as if she's still convinced it's nothing to be worried about.

links.title: You: ""It may have been some sort of... r..."
links.text: "It may have been some sort of... rare electrical anomaly."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""A prank is more likely, no? The ki..."
links.text: "A prank is more likely, no? The kids these days..." She shakes her head. "We were just one of them and now they're terrorizing us. No solidarity."

links.title: You: ""Actually... the Slipstream SCA mys..."
links.text: "Actually... the Slipstream SCA mystery might be a *recording*. I called again later and got exactly the same message."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Why would Slipstream SCA have a hu..."
links.text: "Why would Slipstream SCA have a hundred-years-old recording as their doorbell message? It doesn't make any sense."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I'm still convinced it was nothing..."
links.text: "I'm still convinced it was nothing more than some elaborate prank."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""My money's on *electrical anomaly*..."
links.text: "My money's on *electrical anomaly*. I've heard of these. Especially in an old building like this..." He looks around.

links.title: You: ""I have a few more questions about..."
links.text: "I have a few more questions about the building."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Sure, I'm listening.""
links.text: "Sure, I'm listening."

links.title: You: ""I found the building's intercom, b..."
links.text: "I found the building's intercom, but it's not working."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Oh, right!" She rubs her forehead;..."
links.text: "Oh, right!" She rubs her forehead; her scarf has left a faint line on her dusky skin. "I hope you didn't try to ring me."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I think none of those doorbells wo..."
links.text: "I think none of those doorbells work, including mine. I'm still in the middle of connecting the wires -- sorry about the confusion."

links.title: Logic: "The doorbell with the empty name ca..."
links.text: The doorbell with the empty name card must belong to her then.

links.title: You: ""Actually, I had other questions...""
links.text: "Actually, I had other questions..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Good. I hope it clarified things a..."
links.text: "Good. I hope it clarified things a bit. What else?"

links.title: You: ""Do you know what happened to other..."
links.text: "Do you know what happened to other tenants? Everyone else is gone."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""More or less." She adjusts the yel..."
links.text: "More or less." She adjusts the yellow scarf that covers her hair. "Are you interested in anyone specific?"

links.title: Logic: "Oh, quite a lot of them spring to m..."
links.text: Oh, quite a lot of them spring to mind.

links.title: Shivers: "Rats scuttle in the dark rooms, und..."
links.text: Rats scuttle in the dark rooms, under the abandoned blow driers and dusty mannequins, cobwebs cover rotors and radiocomputers alike... so much failure.

links.title: You: "Why hasn't her business failed..."
links.text: Why hasn't her business failed...

links.title: Shivers: "A gust of cold air sweeps through t..."
links.text: A gust of cold air sweeps through the chimney. The stones and minerals on the shelves rattle as though agitated. For a moment it almost feels as though you're *outside* the building, exposed to the atmosphere...

links.title: You: ""Hey, Neha... The curse is real and..."
links.text: "Hey, Neha... The curse is real and I figured out why it has spared you."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Didn't we already talk about this?..."
links.text: "Didn't we already talk about this?" she asks, as the wind continues to seep in through the cracks in the old chimney.

links.title: You: ""It's because you're not *in* the s..."
links.text: "It's because you're not *in* the same building as the others. This isn't *technically* the Doomed Commercial Area."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""What are you talking about?" she s..."
links.text: "What are you talking about?" she says, shaking her head. "My address is exactly the same -- Rue de Saint-Ghislaine 10."

links.title: Shivers: "No. The old coal plant that used to..."
links.text: No. The old coal plant that used to be here was subsumed into the new venture, its ruins swallowed up -- yet it has a different address in the heart of the city.

links.title: You: ""No, this used to be a coal plant."..."
links.text: "No, this used to be a coal plant." (Touch the safety curtains.) "You're in a chimney of *another* building."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""This doesn't make any sense." She..."
links.text: "This doesn't make any sense." She looks around the makeshift nest that she has carved out for herself, bewildered.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Are you saying my business was spa..."
links.text: "Are you saying my business was spared because of a *technicality*? Where is this coming from?"

links.title: You: ""Let's say I have my own methods......"
links.text: "Let's say I have my own methods... Unusual methods."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""And what, does it mean that I'm sa..."
links.text: "And what, does it mean that I'm safe from failure?"

links.title: Inland Empire: "Don't let her become complacent! Sh..."
links.text: Don't let her become complacent! She still needs to ward *her soul* against the evil forces!

links.title: You: ""Actually, it's only your workshop..."
links.text: "Actually, it's only your workshop that's protected. You should still do something to defend your person."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "She starts laughing, her fingers tr..."
links.text: She starts laughing, her fingers trying to rub away the exhaustion from her face.

links.title: You: ""What?""
links.text: "What?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Do you know what this is?" She rai..."
links.text: "Do you know what this is?" She raises her hand to reveal a piece of metal shining on her index finger.

links.title: You: ""Your lucky charm? Some kind of a w..."
links.text: "Your lucky charm? Some kind of a ward?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It's a mourning ring," she replies..."
links.text: "It's a mourning ring," she replies. "I made this when my first company failed. It was a small jewellery shop right here in the East Delta Commerce Centre, built with the little I inherited from my parents..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I drove it into the ground within..."
links.text: "I drove it into the ground within a year. I didn't have what you would call a *viable* business plan."

links.title: You: ""See? The curse is real! I bet you..."
links.text: "See? The curse is real! I bet you didn't run this little jewellery shop from the protective depths of the chimney?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""No, you're right, I didn't." She l..."
links.text: "No, you're right, I didn't." She laughs again, but it sounds rather small and sad.

links.title: You: ""Why are you telling me this?""
links.text: "Why are you telling me this?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It wasn't just the jewellery shop..."
links.text: "It wasn't just the jewellery shop either. I always thought that it was just the world, that you were supposed to try again and again until you finally succeed."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""And now you're telling me, what?"..."
links.text: "And now you're telling me, what?" She closes her eyes. "That it was all because I didn't run my little shops and ventures from a dump inside an abandoned chimney?"

links.title: You: ""Don't call it a dump, you've made..."
links.text: "Don't call it a dump, you've made it nice and cosy here."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Yeah." She stares out of the windo..."
links.text: "Yeah." She stares out of the window, not really hearing your words. "Or maybe it's the entire world that's cursed? It's such a precarious place. Nothing ever works out the way you wanted."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""That's why people like role-playin..."
links.text: "That's why people like role-playing games. You can be whoever you want to be. You can try again. Still, there's something inherently violent even about dice rolls."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It's like every time you cast a di..."
links.text: "It's like every time you cast a die, something disappears. Some alternative ending, or an entirely different world..." She picks up a pair of dice from the table and examines them under the light.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""But anyway... thanks for sharing y..."
links.text: "But anyway... thanks for sharing your theories, officer." She gives you a tired smile.

links.title: You: ""I'm sorry. I don't know what to sa..."
links.text: "I'm sorry. I don't know what to say. It's entropy."

links.title: You: ""Yes. Coincidence is all that safeg..."
links.text: "Yes. Coincidence is all that safeguards us."

links.title: You: ""It looks like a regular piece of j..."
links.text: "It looks like a regular piece of jewellery to me."

links.title: You: ""I don't care what it is, I only ca..."
links.text: "I don't care what it is, I only came to tell you about why you haven't failed yet."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""It's a mourning ring," she replies..."
links.text: "It's a mourning ring," she replies, talking over your voice. "I made this when my first company failed. It was a small jewellery shop right here in the East Delta Commerce Centre, built with the little I inherited from my parents..."

links.title: You: "(Look away.) "I want to talk about..."
links.text: (Look away.) "I want to talk about something else now."

links.title: You: ""No one's really ever safe from the..."
links.text: "No one's really ever safe from the failure."

links.title: You: ""Rest assured, no psychic attacks w..."
links.text: "Rest assured, no psychic attacks will reach you here."

links.title: You: ""It has a different address in the..."
links.text: "It has a different address in the heart of the city."

links.title: You: ""I'm just using logic -- it's windy..."
links.text: "I'm just using logic -- it's windy in here. You probably haven't properly sealed the chimney crown." (Point above.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Hmm," she says, looking up. "You'r..."
links.text: "Hmm," she says, looking up. "You're right, I should take a trip to the roof once the snow is gone."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Does it mean that I'm safe from fa..."
links.text: "Does it mean that I'm safe from failure?"

links.title: You: ""This is still just a theory, but h..."
links.text: "This is still just a theory, but hear me out: I think I know why your business hasn't failed."

links.title: Shivers: "Aside from getting naked, you're no..."
links.text: Aside from getting naked, you're not sure what else to do. The building holds no more answers for you.

links.title: Shivers: "You feel nothing. If anything, it's..."
links.text: You feel nothing. If anything, it's uncomfortably *warm* in here.

links.title: You: "Start taking off your clothes. You..."
links.text: Start taking off your clothes. You need to *connect*.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Excuse me, what are you doing?" Th..."
links.text: "Excuse me, what are you doing?" The dicemaker stares at you while you start to fuss with your pants.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Officer!" The lieutenant exclaims..."
links.text: "Officer!" The lieutenant exclaims sharply.

links.title: You: ""The zipper... it's stuck!""
links.text: "The zipper... it's stuck!"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Oh no, not the *zipper*." She roll..."
links.text: "Oh no, not the *zipper*." She rolls over to the other end of her table with her chair, looking for something to grab from the tool box.

links.title: Interfacing: "A tool to get the zipper open?"
links.text: A tool to get the zipper open?

links.title: You: ""Is it just me or is it hot in here?""
links.text: "Is it just me or is it hot in here?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""No, I don't feel *hot*. We're in a..."
links.text: "No, I don't feel *hot*. We're in a derelict smokestack. If anything then it's *cold* here!"

links.title: You: ""I'm trying to lower my body temper..."
links.text: "I'm trying to lower my body temperature."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""And *why* would you do that?!""
links.text: "And *why* would you do that?!"

links.title: You: ""It's part of this special *techniq..."
links.text: "It's part of this special *technique* I have."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""And what technique is that?!" She..."
links.text: "And what technique is that?!" She squints at you, a little astonished at what she's hearing. You still haven't gotten your zipper open.

links.title: You: ""Okay, hear me out: Sometimes I get..."
links.text: "Okay, hear me out: Sometimes I get these *feelings*..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Miss, I apologize for my colleague..."
links.text: "Miss, I apologize for my colleague's behaviour. He's still recovering from an *unusual* medical episode..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Officer, this isn't how *mature* a..."
links.text: "Officer, this isn't how *mature* adults deal with their *feelings*."

links.title: Shivers: "*Now* you feel something, the cold..."
links.text: *Now* you feel something, the cold damp of shame washing over you.

links.title: You: ""No, not like that. It's like I can..."
links.text: "No, not like that. It's like I can feel the *wind* or, I don't know, the *air pressure*, and then the air *tells* me things."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""The air pressure told you to take..."
links.text: "The air pressure told you to take your pants off in my studio?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "This is not going very well, is it..."
links.text: This is not going very well, is it -- word wise?

links.title: You: ""Yes, exactly.""
links.text: "Yes, exactly."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Can you please employ this special..."
links.text: "Can you please employ this special *technique* somewhere else? I work here and my work requires concentration. Half-naked people don't help with that." She turns away, so that you can zip up your pants again.

links.title: You: ""No, no, I'm not explaining this ve..."
links.text: "No, no, I'm not explaining this very well."

links.title: You: ""Can we please just forget this eve..."
links.text: "Can we please just forget this ever happened?" (Do up your pants.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""*Gladly*." The dicemaker turns awa..."
links.text: "*Gladly*." The dicemaker turns away so that you can do up your pants.

links.title: You: ""You know what? Forget it. It was a..."
links.text: "You know what? Forget it. It was a bad idea." (Do up your pants.)

links.title: You: ""Never mind, that was a terrible id..."
links.text: "Never mind, that was a terrible idea." (Do up your pants.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Undressing in a stranger's place o..."
links.text: "Undressing in a stranger's place of business? Yes, it was -- an unbelievably bad idea." She trembles, as if trying to shake it off.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Miss, I apologize for my colleague..."
links.text: "Miss, I apologize for my colleague's behaviour. He's still recovering from an *unusual* medical episode..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "That doesn't really excuse it, does..."
links.text: That doesn't really excuse it, does it.

links.title: You: "Leave it at that."
links.text: Leave it at that.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "She has begun to idly clean one of..."
links.text: She has begun to idly clean one of her carving tools with a dirty kerchief, the tool's sharp edge shining in the light of her desk lamp.

links.title: You: ""I think I found the *actual* sourc..."
links.text: "I think I found the *actual* source of the curse."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""You mean the curse that I'm spared..."
links.text: "You mean the curse that I'm spared of because I live outside its immediate reach?"

links.title: You: ""Yes, well... about that.""
links.text: "Yes, well... about that."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I'm listening." She leans back in..."
links.text: "I'm listening." She leans back in her chair, arms crossed across the chest.

links.title: You: "(Just say it.) "There's a two-milli..."
links.text: (Just say it.) "There's a two-millimetre hole in reality located in a church on the other side of the canal. I think it may be related to pale."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Excuse me?" She sits up, visibly a..."
links.text: "Excuse me?" She sits up, visibly agitated. "A two-millimetre hole in reality? This can't be true."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm afraid it is, ma'am. Soona Luu..."
links.text: "I'm afraid it is, ma'am. Soona Luukanen-Kilde, the former lead programmer of Fortress Accident, made the discovery."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Soona is involved in this?" She ap..."
links.text: "Soona is involved in this?" She appears to take this in while the chatter from her headphones continues unabated...

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""So it's even worse than I thought...."
links.text: "So it's even worse than I thought. It's not just the commercial area that's cursed, it's *the entire world*."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "She looks outside the window where..."
links.text: She looks outside the window where daylight has filled the yard.

links.title: You: ""What? No, I wouldn't go as far to..."
links.text: "What? No, I wouldn't go as far to say that the entire world is doomed."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Just Martinaise?" She gives you a..."
links.text: "Just Martinaise?" She gives you a rueful smile and takes a look around...

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""In any case, thank you for stoppin..."
links.text: "In any case, thank you for stopping by. It's good to have an answer, even if I can't claim to understand it fully."

links.title: You: ""It's what I have preached the whol..."
links.text: "It's what I have preached the whole time -- and no one listened."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""A 'curse' is something superstitio..."
links.text: "A 'curse' is something superstitious, but a two-millimetre hole in reality?" She gives you a rueful smile. "We all know what it means -- it's pale."

links.title: You: ""Don't worry about it. You've been..."
links.text: "Don't worry about it. You've been doing fine so far. I'm sure it's nothing."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""You mean considering the fact that..."
links.text: "You mean considering the fact that the world is collapsing on my porch?" She gives you a rueful smile and takes a look around...

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: "She sighs. "I guess the least I can..."
links.text: She sighs. "I guess the least I can do is check up on Soona, see how she's doing."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "She looks outside the window where..."
links.text: She looks outside the window where the night has fallen on the yard.

links.title: You: ""I'm afraid it is. Soona Luukanen-K..."
links.text: "I'm afraid it is. Soona Luukanen-Kilde, the former lead programmer of Fortress Accident, made the discovery."

links.title: You: ""Now that I think about it... It so..."
links.text: "Now that I think about it... It sounds too preposterous to say out loud."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""What? You came all the way up here..."
links.text: "What? You came all the way up here to tell me that you *can't* tell me because I won't like the answer?"

links.title: You: ""It's a bit more complicated than I..."
links.text: "It's a bit more complicated than I first thought it would be."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I thought we agreed that the curse..."
links.text: "I thought we agreed that the curse isn't real."

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""You're back," the bird-like woman..."
dialogueTree.text: "You're back," the bird-like woman says, looking up from her table. "Did you decide what kind of die you want?"

links.title: You: ""Hold on, what do you mean by *mili..."
links.text: "Hold on, what do you mean by *milieus*?"

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Yes, a milieu is like a call-in st..."
links.text: "Yes, a milieu is like a call-in station. You need a two-way radio to access one. That's why I have these." She pats the headphones on the table.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Mostly they just teach you to swea..."
links.text: "Mostly they just teach you to swear in different languages, but some of the stations can be quite interesting. I was so absorbed, I must have missed you knocking."

links.title: You: ""You must have me confused with som..."
links.text: "You must have me confused with someone else -- I haven't knocked on your window."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Then how did you get inside? By th..."
links.text: "Then how did you get inside? By the south entrance?" She blinks. "You know what, it doesn't even matter. What matters is that you're finally here. Let's talk dice -- did you have something specific in mind?"

links.title: You: ""Why are you asking me about *dice*..."
links.text: "Why are you asking me about *dice*?" (Move on.)

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I'm a novelty dicemaker," she says..."
links.text: "I'm a novelty dicemaker," she says. "Tell me the name of your role-playing system and I'll make the die you need. That's why you're here, yes?"

links.title: Physical Instrument: "As she speaks her bone-like fingers..."
links.text: As she speaks her bone-like fingers fiddle with a ring. Her bones light, but her hands strong.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Role-playing games? You know role-p..."
links.text: Role-playing games? You know role-playing games: Wirrâl, Wirrâl Untethered, um, what else...

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Role-playing games? You know Wirrâl..."
links.text: Role-playing games? You know Wirrâl. Does that count?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Role-playing games? You know the on..."
links.text: Role-playing games? You know the one made by Fortress Accident. Does that count?

links.title: You: ""Sure, I like role-playing games an..."
links.text: "Sure, I like role-playing games and I need some dice."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Very good," she says. "My rate is..."
links.text: "Very good," she says. "My rate is 10 reál per set, unless you want something really unusual..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Take a look around and see if ther..."
links.text: "Take a look around and see if there's any particular stone you want to use." The walls around her are covered with rows of precious stones and minerals.

links.title: Conceptualization: "It almost looks as if the stones an..."
links.text: It almost looks as if the stones and dice are a natural part of the room, growing out of the shelves like stalagmites.

links.title: You: ""Maybe. I'm not really sure why I'm..."
links.text: "Maybe. I'm not really sure why I'm here, honestly."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""How strange," she says. "Well, if..."
links.text: "How strange," she says. "Well, if you're interested, my rate is 10 reál per set, unless you want something really unusual..."

links.title: You: ""No, I was looking for something el..."
links.text: "No, I was looking for something else..." (Squint your eyes mysteriously.) "*Answers*."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Answers? How strange. These days p..."
links.text: "Answers? How strange. These days people only come to me for dice and role-playing games..."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""I'm not sure how helpful I'll be,..."
links.text: "I'm not sure how helpful I'll be, but go ahead and ask." The walls around her are covered with rows of precious stones and minerals.

links.title: You: ""I'm not interested in buying dice..."
links.text: "I'm not interested in buying dice right now. I'm a police officer and I need to ask some questions."

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Of course, I can see that. I just..."
links.text: "Of course, I can see that. I just thought you were a police officer looking for dice..." She tilts her bird-like head. "How else can I help you then?"

links.title: Suggestion: "This person means you -- or no one..."
links.text: This person means you -- or no one else -- absolutely no harm. She will answer freely and honestly.

links.title: Drama: "No falsehoods are present. She's a..."
links.text: No falsehoods are present. She's a novelty dicemaker and doesn't have anything to hide. Ask what you need.

links.title: You: ""Never mind, I'll be back later." [..."
links.text: "Never mind, I'll be back later." [Leave.]

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""As you wish. Till next time," she..."
links.text: "As you wish. Till next time," she nods, turning back to her table.

dialogueTree.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Oh, it's you again. Did you try kn..."
dialogueTree.text: "Oh, it's you again. Did you try knocking on my window before? Are you looking for a die?"

dialogueTree.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Hello, I'm Neha." A bird-like woma..."
dialogueTree.text: "Hello, I'm Neha." A bird-like woman sits on a throne of tools, with emerald light shining through her hair.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""Did you try knocking on my window?..."
links.text: "Did you try knocking on my window? I must have missed you, I've been listening to my *milieus*." She taps on her headphones.

links.title: Novelty Dicemaker: ""So, what kind of die are you looki..."
links.text: "So, what kind of die are you looking for?"

links.title: Inland Empire: "Could this be the malicious Entity?..."
links.text: Could this be the malicious Entity? Perhaps it's wise to go along with this *masquerade* for now...

links.title: Visual Calculus: "She's got a direct view to the back..."
links.text: She's got a direct view to the backyard. You should interrogate her about the lynching.
